messages.body:
ATTENTION:
I am MR DANGOTE ALINCO, Bank Manager Orient Bank Nig Plc,Victoria Island Branch,Lagos, Nigeria. I have an urgent and confidential business proposal for you.

PROPOSAL:
On November 6, 1999, a Foreign oil merchant/Contractor with the NIGERIAN NATIONAL PETROLEUM COPORATION, MR KEN POWER, made a numbered time(Fixed) Deposit for twelve (12) calendar months,valued at US$28,000,000.00 (Twenty-Eight Million Dollars)in my branch. Upon maturity, I sent a routine notification to his forwarding address but got no reply. After a month,we sent a reminder and finally we discovered from his contract employers,THE NIGERIAN NATIONAL PETROLEUM COPORATION that MR KEN POWER died from an automobile accident.

On further investigation,I found out that he died without making a WILL and all attempts to trace his NEXT OF KIN was friutless. I therefore made further investigation and discovered that MR KEN POWER did not declare any KIN OR RELATIONS IN ALL HIS OFFICIAL DOCUMENTS, INCLUDING HIS BANK DEPOSIT PAPER WORK IN MY BANK. This sum of US$28,000,000.00 is still sitting in my Bank and the interest is being rolled over with the principal sum at the end of each year. NO PERSON WILL EVER COME FOWARD TO CLAIM IT.

According to NIGERIAN LAW, at the expiration of 5(FIVE) YEARS, the money will revert to the ownership of the NIGERIAN FEDERAL GOVERNMENT IF NOBODY APPLIES TO CLAIM THE FUND.

Consequently, my proposal is that I WANT YOU TO STAND IN AS THE NEXT OF KIN/BENEFICIARY OF THIS FUND. So that the fruits of this old man?s labour will not get into the hands of some corrupt government officials.What we are going to do is simple.You have to provide the following information.

1; YOUR FULL NAMES AND ADDRESS:
2: YOUR PRIVATE PHONE AND FAX NUMBERS:
3: YOUR BANKING INFORMATION:

We shall use these information to prepare DOCUMENTS AND AFFIDAVITS, THROUGH AN ACCREDITED ATTORNEY REPRESENTING YOU AS THE NEXT OF KIN/BENEFICIARY OF THIS FUND DEPOSIT.We shall need the services of the Attorney for the DRAFTING AND NOTARISATION OF THE WILL,AND FOR OBTAINING ALL NECESSARY DOCUMENTS AND LETTER OF PROBATE/ADMINISTRATION IN YOUR FAVOUR FOR THE TRANSFER OF THE FUND into an account you will provide.

For your assistance, you will be adequately compensated with 40%) of the total sum. (55%) will be my own share while (5%) will be set aside to cover any incidental expenses made both at home and abroad before conclusion of this deal.This transaction is 100% risk free as the paper work will be done by the Attorney and my position as the Branch Manager guarantees the successful execution. If you are interested in assisting me in this transaction,please reply immidiately via my email under.Upon your response, I shall then provide you with more details and relevant documents that will help you understand this transaction better.

Please realise that the confidentiality of this arrangement must be maintained from now, and even after the successful complition of this transaction.I will meet with you in your country for disbursement after the fund has been released to you and also to discuss investment potentials as I will like to invest in your country with your assistance.

Thank you.

Regards,
MR DANGOTE ALINCO.

NB :RESPOND TO MY PRIVATE EMAIL : dangotealinco@yahoo.com

messages.body:
Received: from  

ATTN:  MARGARET,

MY DEAR FRIEND.

COMPLIMENTS OF THE DAY TO YOU.I RECEIVED YOUR MAIL AND
I AM VERY HAPPY THAT YOU ARE WILLING AND READY TO
ASSIST US ACTUALISE THIS TRANSACTION. MY COLLEAGUES
AND I HAVE DELIBERATED ON YOUR MAIL AND WE HAVE
REACHED A CONSENSUS THAT WORK SHOULD COMMENSE
IMMEDIATELY.THIS IS A VERY SERIOUS PROPOSAL AND I WILL APPRECIATE IT IF IT IS HANDLED AS SUCH. I NEED SOMEBODY THAT I CAN TRUST AND I BELIEVE I CAN TRUST YOU.

WITH YOUR READINESS IN  ASSISTING ME ACTUALISE THIS TRANSACTION, I BELIEVE THAT IF WE WORK COOPERATIVELY WE WOULD BE ABLE TO CONCLUDE THIS TRANSACTION IN A MATTER OF 5-7 WORKING DAYS. WELL,IT IS VERY IMPORTANT TO LET YOU KNOW A LITTLE BIT OF MYSELF, I HAVE BEEN WORKING WITH STANDARD TRUST BANK FOR THE PAST 25 YEARS,MARRIED WITH 4 CHILDREN.I WILL ALSO APPRECIATE IT IF YOU WILL AVAIL ME SOME OF THESE INFORMATIONS;

1. ARE YOU MARRIED WITH KIDS ?
2. I HOPE WE WILL NOT HAVE PROBLEMS WITH YOUR BANK BECAUSE OF THE VOLUME ? IN OTHER WORDS CAN YOUR BANK ACCOUNT ACCOMODATE THE    VOLUME OF FUNDS TO BE TRANSFERRED ?.

HOWEVER, TO BE ABLE TO CARRY OUT THIS TRANSACTION,WE HAVE SOLICITED FOR THE SERVICES OF AN ATTORNEY WHO WILL ASSIST US IN WRITING AN APPLICATION FOR CLAIMS ON YOUR BEHALF. THEREFORE,YOUR BANK ACCOUNT PARTICULARS WILL BE ATTACHED TO THE APPLICATION AND SUBMITTED TO THE FOREIGN TRANSACTION DEPARTMENT.FURTHERMORE,WE AGREED THAT UPON RECEIPT OF THE FUNDS INTO THE BANK ACCOUNT THAT YOU WILL NOMINATE FOR THIS TRANSACTION,YOU SHOULD WITHOLD 40% AS INDICATED IN MY PROPOSAL,55% FOR MY COLLEAGUES AND MY SELF WHILE THE REMAINING 5% HAS BEEN EARMARKED FOR BOTH LOCAL AND
INTERNATIONAL EXPENSES THAT MIGHT BE INCURRED IN THE
COURSE OF THIS TRANSACTION.

 WE HAVE WORKED OUT MODALITIES ON HOW THIS TRANSACTION WOULD BE CARRIED OUT SUCCESSFULLY IN THE SHORTEST POSSIBLE TIME. AFTER SUBMITTING THE APPLICATION, I WILL THEN RETRIEVE THE DOCUMENTS USED IN THE SETTING UP OF THE ACCOUNT INITIALLY FROM THE FILE OF OUR LATE CUSTOMER
AND THEN WRITE/INDICATE YOUR NAME AS THE NEXT OF KIN AND PROCESS OTHER DOCUMENTS THAT WILL HAVE YOU AS THE
BONAFIDE BENEFICIARY. THESE DOCUMENTS WOULD BE SENT TO YOU ALSO ON PROCUREMENT.ONCE THE DOCUMENTS ARE
PROCESSED AND APPROVAL GOTTEN,THEN THE FOREIGN TRANSACTION DEPARTMENT WILL CONTACT YOU TO MAKE ALL
NECESSARY ARRANGEMENTS FOR THE TRANSFER.

I AM LOOKING FORWARD TO CONSOLIDATING OUR RELATIONSHIP
IN THE NEAR FUTURE.PLEASE LIKE I CLEARLY STATED IN MY PROPOSAL,WE
HAVE TO KEEP THIS TRANSACTION VERY SECRET BECAUSE OF ITS CONFIDENTIAL
NATURE.PLEASE ENDEAVOUR TO INCLUDE YOUR TELEPHONE AND FAX NUMBERS IN YOUR RESPONSE TO THIS MAIL.MEANWHILE,MY DIRECT TELEPHONE NUMBER IS
234 - 1 - 8920325, YOU CAN ALWAYS REACH ME ON THIS NUMBER.FOR SECURITY
REASONS, ALL CORRESPONDENCE SHOULD BE DIRECTED THIS MAIL ADDRESS:

I AWAIT YOUR BANK  PARTICULARS.

BEST REGARDS AND GOD BLESS


ALINCO  DANGOTE

messages.body:
Dear Mr Alinco

Thank you for your very prompt and detailed reply, written rather alarmingly in capitals (I was wondering if you have a problem with pharmaceutical abuse out there?). May I congratulate you on your attention to detail and business acuity.

As far as your questions go, I can answer with the following:

I am blessed with three lovely children, Princess Candy as well as Princess Wayne and Darren.

Do not worry about the large influx of funds into the Royal Wankershire Bank. I maintain a substantial balance there and the Manager, Mr Vimto will be entirely unfazed.

I must admit to some degree of hesitation in supplying my direct phone number so readily. You will understand that the current security situation makes this a contentious issue. After all we have yet to establish trust and I would not want my number bandied around drinking holes and night clubs.

However I do want to offer some gesture so have arranged for the following fax number to be made available: 44 906 174 3615.

In the meantime please attend to your phone number as it appears to be answered by some jabbering inebriate.


MARGARET


Her Royal Highness Princess Margaret

messages.body:
Received: from 

Attn: Margaret,

Good day to you. I am very sorry for the late response, as a matter of fact I have been very busy trying to work out arrangements that will have us conclude this transaction in good time.I am also sorry for the capital letters.I just wanted to ensure that they came to you clearly.

However, the application for claims has be written by the attorney on your behalf and I was processing the other documents which I will be sending to you by fax on friday as soon as the attorney secures other documents.

Please bear with me for the delay. Once the approvals are secured the bank will contact you to finalise arrangement for the transfer.

Do confirm the receipt of this mail and my regards to your princesses,tell them that I am looking forward to meeting them very soon.

Best regards.

Alinco Dangote.

messages.subject: Danote: Sorry For The Delay/HRH - hurry up we are very interested
messages.body:
Dear Dangoat

We are much relieved to hear back from you and so pleased that you are putting every effort into forwarding this important business. I must admit as to some apprehension as we were beginning to think that you had been caught up in some of the dreadful upheavals which we have heard of in your part of the world.

Prince Candy and the Royal Princes Darren and Wayne are very enthusiastic about this business and I am sure that your plans will get the response they surely deserve.

Please keep in touch as we are very eager to proceed.

Warmest regards

MARGARET

Her Royal Highness Princess Margaret

messages.body:
Dear Mr Alinco

Thank you for your very prompt and detailed reply, written rather alarmingly in capitals (I was wondering if you have a problem with pharmaceutical abuse out there?). May I congratulate you on your attention to detail and business acuity.

As far as your questions go, I can answer with the following:

I am blessed with three lovely children, Princess Candy as well as Princess Wayne and Darren.

Do not worry about the large influx of funds into the Royal Wankershire Bank. I maintain a substantial balance there and the Manager, Mr Vimto will be entirely unfazed.

I must admit to some degree of hesitation in supplying my direct phone number so readily. You will understand that the current security situation makes this a contentious issue. After all we have yet to establish trust and I would not want my number bandied around drinking holes and night clubs.

However I do want to offer some gesture so have arranged for the following fax number to be made available: 44 906 174 3615.

In the meantime please attend to your phone number as it appears to be answered by some jabbering inebriate.

Her Royal Highness Princess Margaret

messages.body:
My Dear Dangoat

I must admit to some consternation that your security has been broken so easily. Does this mean our top secret discussions have been compromised? I am very nervous now. We are so close to confirming this business that any interruption would be disasterous. I am very alarmed that your secretary has tampered with your mail account. If you recruit again, may I suggest looking at one of our great public schools for candidates, where such native chicanery would be out of the question. (My own assistant, a charming if somewhat diffident fellow called Ilichy Miracsky, comes from the Royal College of Smegaroon).

Please reassure me and remind me where we are in this business.

Margaret

PS I note that your name is now appearing under a Portuguese nom de plume. Have you ever been to Lisbon? They play excellent polo there and Prince Wayne is a big enthusiast.

messages.subject: are your wives coming?
messages.body:
Dear Mr Dan Goat

This is the third message from you today and I am growing more bemused. Am I to trust your bank or not? Please make this clear. Has your secretary been discharged yet? I do not want to think that the scoundrel is still in your employ. If he was here, he would be shown the door by Palace security and with no standing on politeness I can tell you that! I think that all crooks and dishonest fellows should be whipped through the streets and I am sure you will agree with me. Do you still cut off hands in your country?

On a happier note, did you have a chance to consider your requirements when you pay us a visit? We can offer some reggae music in the evenings to make you feel more at home, and I am sure that Prince Wayne will want to show you his X-Box games collection. (If you can bring him a new one or two it will be much appreciated. I am so tired of Halo). Candy I am sure will want to introduce you to London's somewhat raucous clubland nightlife. If you wish to bring over any of your wives, please let us know by the way so that we can arrange matters. (Do you sleep all in the same bed, by the way?)

In any case we still wait to have our anxieties resolved as previously communicated.

MARGARET

messages.body:
Dear Mr Dangoat

I am very relieved that I have these assurances from you after all this hesitation, and the problems you have had with staff of late. However you will still appreciate that I am very apprehensive about providing personal information and documents over the internet, especially given the recent difficulties at your end, as well as the current security condition. The royal family here must make every effort to maintain a distance from rough and unscrupulous elements, especially from the former colonies, where there may be grudges.

Given these conditions, I will have to ask you to sign an Oath of Temporary Allegience to the Crown which will go some way in assuaging our nervousness and put this business on something approaching an ethical footing. It is purely a formality, but we would prefer it were done before We commit Ourselves any further.

Is this acceptable? I am sure that you will understand.

In the meantime you may take my postal address as given below, and my personal mobile number is 0790 6634313.

Best wishes

MARGARET

Her Royal Highness Princess Margaret

Barrymore steps in!

messages.body:
Dear Mr Dancoot

Her graciousness Princess Margaret has indicated to me that you are likely
to be administered with the official Oath of Temporary Allegience to the
Crown, this in lieu of confidential business which I understand is pending.

If you are of sound mind and body and enter into this full quim agreement
voluntarily, *ab inflagrento delecto absnentia* as it were (presumably a
personal visit to this office is out of the question due to your location)
then please advise the best address for the due administration of the
relevant wordage. The Oath will require printing, reading aloud and signing
with a recent clothed photograph.

Her Majesty has asked me to stress the need for prompt and discreet
treatment of the Oath, which is an in exemptore agreement made for the more
merkin palace policies and business.

I await to hear from you, sir as I am led to understand that time is
pressing.

MICHAEL

messages.body:
Dear Mr Dangoat

After sending the previous missive I remembered that you were asking about real estate opportunities (quite naturally, given the investment access gained by such a large windfall).

I have made some enquiries and there may well be something suitable for your background and evident education. My man Miracsky has made some discreet enquiries and We understand that there is a hotel for sale in Kensington with fine potential. If you would like more information about The Chavster, in due course I will be pleased to provide them.

I have asked the Commissioner of Commonwealth Oaths to stand by should you prove willing to undertake the previously mentioned Temporary Allegience pledge. This important element of Palace Protocol is very straightforward, and you should hear from him soon. Do not worry, he is discreet and will not be familiar with the essence of our likely business.

If you have an idea of when you are likely to pay us a visit please let me know so that My staff can air the rooms and prepare the fruit baskets and what not

Hoping the hot weather finds you and your wives well.

MARGARET

Her Royal Highness Princess Margaret

messages.body:
Nov 6



Dear Mr Dangoat

I am delighted that you feel able to indulge our request, which will considerably oil the wheels of any business between us. You may be thinking that this is all so much red tape and archaic nonsense, I am sure, but the Oath is an honoured tradition here. Many fine and upstanding individuals, shrewd business operators all, have worked with us recently under its priviledged auspices.

Mr Barrymore will be pleased to answer any specific questions as to the Oath, far more accurately than I can hope to do. Needless to say that the agreement is confidential and confers a great honour upon those to whom it is offered. You can rest assured that as soon as it completed, your reputation and mental acuity will be fully established. I shall ask Mr Barrymore to send on the text as soon as possible so that we can then proceed without further ado. If you have a legal advisor, favoured wife, or a village chief to whom it is best shown before completing matters, then feel free to do so.

As far as the hotel is concerned, I will have to make some more enquiries naturally but I am convinced that the property will make an excellent prospect for investment. The current owner, a man called Bates, has an urgent need to sell and I am sure that a sale could be secured for a very reasonable sum. It is situated a little back from the road, but has charming period features and is rather well known in our part of the world. I understand that some refurbishment has taken place inside, and the showers are especially modern. To help you ascertain the quality on offer I am attaching a recent image, showing incidentally a large party of guests entering the establishment, which as you can see, is very popular. Perhaps if things go as far as to purchase we might look to offering some of your own locale cusine as a novelty? I am sure cous cous, lentils or a finger dish of creamy Blattella Germanica will do excellently. Just a few ideas.

I have understand how keenly the bank await my response and all is being prepared. In the meantime do hurry along with the oath my good man so that all can be resolved.

Best wishes

Margaret


Her Royal Highness Princess Margaret VC

messages.subject: Alincote - Please send the details/HRH: I am sure the Bates will sell...
messages.body:
Nov 8


Dear Mr Dan Goat

Many thanks for keeping Me up to date on the progress of this business.

I have passed Mr Barrymore news of your acquiesence to taking the Oath and he will no doubt be in touch with the relevant text shortly. Please let Me know if you have any questions.

Just as soon as that formality is completed then we can proceed and ensure you get what you truly deserve.

As far as the hotel is concerned, I have asked my staff to contact Mr Bates the owner, he and his reclusive mother are looking to sell in very short order, so I am sure the price will be reasonable. In my opinion they would be mad not to act.

Perhaps we may look at honouring the establishment with a Royal Warrant, 'by appointment to Her Majesty', that sort of thing, which would make it an even greater business attraction. I shall speak to the Thane of Cawdor, Master of the Warrants to see if this can be done without making too much of a drama.

If you remind Me of your postal address, the land agents may wish to send a prospectus of The Chavster for your persual.

Best regards


MARGARET



Her Royal Highness Princess Margaret VC

messages.body:
Nov 8

Dear Mr Alinco

I am pleased now to administer the Oath of Temporary Allegience to the
House of Windsor, which will be taken on a con flagrente delecto basis, as
previous summarised. This, as I understand it, is in connection with
business outstanding with her gracious highness Princess Margaret?

The Oath should be printed out, signed legibly (if you cannot write you may
just make a mark, initialed by the chosen witness) witnessed and returned
with a recent photograph showing one hand on your breast in act of suitable
obeisance. 

"I, , do solemnly swear that I will bear true faith and
allegiance to the Royal House of Windsor, in full quims; and that I take
this obligation freely, without any mental reservation or purpose of
evasion in this right Royal business; be cognsicant of said due fey merkins
and that I will well and faithfully discharge the duties of the business on
which I am about to enter pursuant to all vimto. So help me God."

(signed)......         (witnessed)..........   (date).........

Please note that the normal time for return of this Oath completed is no
longer than 7 working days or the doobray may be promulgated.

If you have any questions I am available to resolve such queries most days
9 - 5.

Best regards

MICHAEL
messages.raw:

So help me God."

(signed)...... (witnessed).......... (date).........

Please note that the normal time for return of this Oath completed is no longer than 7 working days or the doobray may be promulgated.

If you have any questions I am available to resolve such queries most days 9 - 5.

Best regards

MICHAEL

messages.subject: Dangote - can I have your details?/HRH - sign first!
messages.body:
Nov 9

Dear Mr Dangoat

This is splendid news. I almost ready to submit the material required to your bankers, and once we have your Oath on board and approved will do this at once. You will understand that first things are done first, my dear chap.

I sent on some more details about the Chavster Hotel yesterday, did you not get them? I have spoken to the current owner, Mr Norman Bates, and he and his mother are keen to vacate shortly. Do you have any experience in the hotel trade by the way? There is a chance that we can arrange for some work experience here in the palace scullery, should it be required. I am sure that you will soon pick up the routine and some necessary skills.

We look forward to hearing from you.


MARGARET

messages.subject: Dangote - what is happening?/HRH - bad news: Miracksy is now your man..
messages.body:
Dear Mr Dangote

Many thanks for following up your application so promptly. I am pleased to say that we are now very happy to proceed with this business given the Oath's completion. I must say you are a very striking fellow. Unfortunately the previous message from you concerning what is required has been mislaid by my assistant Miracsky, during a recent very happy celebration here at the office. It is he who I have now authorised to proceed with the transaction leaving me free to plan around broader issues such as the real estate venture we are discussing.

Ilichy has been recruited into royal service by the Special Operations Department at the Foreign Office, and is completely discreet and reliable. Please ensure that you express yourself clearly and plainly as his English is occasionally a little inaccurate but you can rest assured you will get what you deserve. You can send him the information to his private e-mail address at ilichy.miracsky@post.cz

If you have any problems let me know. I am very keen now to proceed.


Best regards


MARGARET

messages.body:
November 15, 2004

Dear Mr Dangote,

I am pleased to inform you that Sheikh Yormani of Saudi Arabia has recently decided to sell the Hotel Splendide in Bowden Street Mayfair.

This prestigious 69 bedroom hotel is in the heart of the fashionable West End of London and currently enjoys an occupancy rate of 92%.

Many well-known people from the world of politics, business, sport and entertainment stay at the Hotel Splendide and I can advise you that the asking priceof 6 million is certainly reasonable although the current lease will expire in 2036.

Perhaps you would let me know whether I should make any further enquiries - in strict confidence, of course - on your behalf.

Yours truly,

Charles Farnes-Barnes

messages.subject: Hrh - Dancote: what is happening? Shall I contact Tossov?
messages.body:
Dear Mr Goat

You should have received this information by now, what is happening? I know that Miracsky is applying himself very diligently to the matter, and has sent documents off. Unfortunately he has a half day off today, and has proved rather unintelligible on the phone, after celebrating the Czech National Day last night, but I can check when he comes in.

Also Mr Farnes Barnes has told you that the property he thought most of interest you consider to be too expensive. The Chavster remains on the market however if this seems more suitable.

If you like I can ask our Mr Lonslo Tossov, the Royal Surveyor General to assess this last building for any potential structural problems? I am sure that he will offer some friendly advice.

Wayne and Darren send their regards and wonder if you have a copy of Halo 2? I have told them software is very cheap in the third world.

Looking forward to hearing from you

MARGARET

Her Royal Highness Princess Margaret VC
